Detailed Description

Thread safe message storage.

Possably [depreciated]... ATM seems useable, but all this stuff could be done in NetworkClient (at the expense of its simplicity.) Also, the thread safety is now redundant - FusionNetworkClient / FusionNetworkServer run in the main thread.

Member Function Documentation

void FusionNetworkMessageQueue::_addEvent (  FusionMessage *  message  ) 
 

Used internally. Allows the CE to act on network events.

Parameters:
messageId The packet ID which CE should act on.

void FusionNetworkMessageQueue::Resize (  unsigned short  channels  ) 
 

Use this to pre-allocate the required channels.

This should be called before any retreival functions, to avoid accessing null space.

Member Data Documentation

CL_Mutex* FusionEngine::FusionNetworkMessageQueue::m_Mutex [protected]
 

[depreciated] Used for thread-safety.

Ensures thread-safety by preventing concurrent data access via _getMessages().
